intro: Artanthe arcuata, commonly known as the curved artanthe, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Artanthe arcuata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
